DOC.brief_title: Comparison 18F FDG PET/CT TO PET MRI
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion 1 . Subject must clinical indication PET/CT exam 2 . Subject must least eighteen ( 18 ) year age 3 . Female subject determine nonpregnant physician investigator demonstrate nonpregnant negative urine pregnancy test administer within 24 hour period PET/CT image 4 . Subject must able hear understand instruction without assistive device 5 . Subject must provide write informed consent 6 . Subject necessary mental capacity understand instruction , able comply protocol requirement 7 . Subject able remain still duration image procedure ( approximately 60 minute total PET/MRI ) ; 8 . Subject must able participate PET/MR image session within 1 hour conclude PET/CT exam . Exclusion criteria 1 . Subjects axial diameter large 55 cm 2 . Subjects weight great 499 lbs 3 . Subjects metallic/conductive electrically/magnetically active implant without MR Safe MR Conditional labeling , exception dental devices/fillings , surgical clip , surgical staple determine safe MRI scan physician investigator 4 . Subjects implant MR Unsafe labeling ; 5 . Subjects implant label MR Conditional manufacturer allowable condition expect achieved MR/PET environment scan protocol ; 6 . Subjects contraindication MRI per screen policy participate site .
